doc.title: SAXS Merge
doc.authors: Yannick G. Spill, Seung Joong Kim, Dina Schneidman-Duhovny, Daniel Russel, Ben Webb, Andrej Sali and Michael Nilges

xhtml:div.label: stop after the given step clean up fitting rescaling classification merging
Cleanup step comes after rescaling step (default is False) Yes No
Number of times each profile has been recorded
First line of output files is a header Yes No
Output data files for parsed input files as well. Yes No

Set the output level?
sparse normal full
'sparse' is for q,I,err columns
'normal' adds eorigin, eoriname and eextrapol (default)
'full' outputs all flag

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Discard or keep SAXS curves' points based on their SNR. Points with an error of zero are discarded as well

xhtml:div.label: type I error (default 1e-4)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: To save resources, set the maximum number of points used in the Hessian calculation (model comparison, options baverage, and berror ). Dataset will be subsampled if it is bigger than NUM. If NUM=-1 (default), all points will be used.

xhtml:div.label:
bmean?
Flat Simple Generalized Full
Defines the most complex mean function that will be tried during model comparison.
One of Flat (the offset parameter A is optimized)
Simple (optimizes A, G and Rg)
Generalized (optimizes G, Rg and d)
Full (optimizes G, Rg, d and s) If "Don't perform model comparison" is set, will try to fit only with this model.
perform model comparison Yes No
berror: Compute error bars on all parameters even in case where model comparison was disabled. Yes No

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Find the most probable scaling factor of all curves wrt the first curve.

xhtml:div.label:
Which rescaling model to use to calculate gamma.?
normal normal-offset lognormal
'normal-offset' for a normal model with offset,
'normal' (default) for a normal model with zero offset,
and 'lognormal' for a lognormal model.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Classify the mean curves by comparing them using a two-sided two-sample student t test

xhtml:div.label: type I error (default 0.05)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Find the most probable scaling factor of all curves wrt the first

xhtml:div.label:
Which most complex mean function to try for model comparison.?
Flat Simple Generalized Full
Which mean parameters are optimized.
One of Flat (the offset parameter A is optimized)
Simple (optimizes A, G and Rg)
Generalized (default, optimizes G, Rg and d)
Full (optimizes G, Rg, d and s)

perform model comparison?
Yes No
Perform model comparison, which allows to choose a mean function that does not overfit the data. If ecomp is given, eoptimize is taken to be the most complex model. (Default: don't perform it.)
Compute error bars on all parameters even in case where model comparison was disabled. Yes No
Don't extrapolate at all, even at low angle. Yes No
Skip next option and use q values of the first datafile instead. Yes No
Number of points to output for the mean function.
lower bound for lambda parameter in steps 2 and 5

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Discard or keep SAXS curves' points based on their SNR. Points with an error of zero are discarded as well

xhtml:div.label: when a value after CUT is discarded, the rest of the curve is discarded as well (default is 0.1)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Estimate the mean function and the noise level of each SAXS curve.

xhtml:div.label:
baverage: Average over all possible parameters instead of just taking the most probable set of parameters.
Yes No
Initial value for d
Initial value for s

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Find the most probable scaling factor of all curves wrt the first

xhtml:div.label: Define which input curve the other curves will be recaled to. last first
Number of points to use to compute gamma (default 200)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Collect compatible data and produce best estimate of mean function.

xhtml:div.label:
Average over all possible parameters instead of just taking the most probable set of parameters.
Yes No

Extrapolate NUM percent outside of the curve's bounds.?
Example: if NUM=50 and the highest acceptable data point is at q=0.3, the mean will be estimated up to q=0.45. Default is 0 (just extrapolate at low angle).

xhtml:div.div:
Defines the most complex mean function that will be tried during model comparison.
One of Flat (the offset parameter A is optimized)
Simple (optimizes A, G and Rg)
Generalized (optimizes G, Rg and d)
Full (optimizes G, Rg, d and s) If "Don't perform model comparison" is set, will try to fit only with this model.

ul.li: 'normal-offset' for a normal model with offset,
'normal' (default) for a normal model with zero offset,

xhtml:div.div:
Which mean parameters are optimized.
One of Flat (the offset parameter A is optimized)
Simple (optimizes A, G and Rg)
Generalized (default, optimizes G, Rg and d)
Full (optimizes G, Rg, d and s)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Perform model comparison, which allows to choose a mean function that does not overfit the data. If ecomp is given, eoptimize is taken to be the most complex model. (Default: don't perform it.)
Example: if NUM=50 and the highest acceptable data point is at q=0.3, the mean will be estimated up to q=0.45. Default is 0 (just extrapolate at low angle).

interpolation 3 cols q i err

q i err eorigin eoriname eextrapol
q i err eorigin eoriname eextrapol

format.code: ( "" , " --stop="+value )[value is not None and value != vdef ]

interface.label: stop after the given step clean up fitting rescaling classification merging

parameter.name: postpone_cleanup
parameter.prompt: Cleanup step comes after rescaling step (default is False)

interface.label: Cleanup step comes after rescaling step (default is False) Yes No

parameter.name: nb_expe
parameter.prompt: Number of times each profile has been recorded

message.text: the number of recordings must be > 0

interface.label: Number of times each profile has been recorded

parameter.name: general_header
parameter.prompt: First line of output files is a header

interface.label: First line of output files is a header Yes No

parameter.name: allfiles
parameter.prompt: Output data files for parsed input files as well.

interface.label: Output data files for parsed input files as well. Yes No

format.code: ( "" , " --outlevel="+value)[ value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label:
Set the output level?
sparse normal full
'sparse' is for q,I,err columns
'normal' adds eorigin, eoriname and eextrapol (default)
'full' outputs all flag

comment.text: Discard or keep SAXS curves' points based on their SNR. Points with an error of zero are discarded as well

format.code: ("" , " --bmean="+str(value))[value is not None and value != vdef]

Defines the most complex mean function that will be tried during model comparison.

parameter.prompt: set the maximum number of points used in the Hessian calculation.

comment.text: To save resources, set the maximum number of points used in the Hessian calculation (model comparison, options baverage, and berror ). Dataset will be subsampled if it is bigger than NUM. If NUM=-1 (default), all points will be used.

comment.text: Example: if NUM=50 and the highest acceptable data point is at q=0.3, the mean will be estimated up to q=0.45. Default is 0 (just extrapolate at low angle).
